reference_no_of_permission_being_relied_: Following the approval of application PP/2015/3928 to vary the conditions attached to P/2012/5040, a Section 73 (S73) Application (Ref. 195157VAR) was submitted in December 2019 to vary condition 41 attached to the Hybrid Planning Permission (as amended by application ref. 164907VAR), which allowed the Chapel to come forward solely as a community space (D1 Use Class).
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun no later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.
| Approved Drawings:
CH-2-005 - Red Line Plan (Location Plan)
CH-2-006 -Existing Floor Plan
CH-2-007 - Existing External Elevations
CH-2-008 - Existing External Elevations
CH-2-009 - Existing Internal Elevations
CH-2-010 - Proposed Site Plan
CH-2-100 Rev H - Proposed Floor Plans
CH-2-110 - Proposed Foundations Plan
CH-2-200 Rev G - Proposed Internal Elevations
CH-2-210 - Proposed External Elevation - North
CH-2-211 - Proposed External Elevation - South
CH-2-212 - Proposed External Elevations - West and East
CH-2-250 Rev C - Elevation Bay (C)
CH-2-255 Rev C - Typical Studio Elevations
CH-2-700 - Proposed Details
Method Statement prepared by Hester Architects
Structural Condition Report prepared by Green Structural Engineering (August 2020)
Heritage Statement prepared by Turley Heritage (February 2023)
St Bernards Hospital - Chapel - DAS prepared by Hester architects 09 Feb 23
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Prior to the commencement of work a full historical recording (Historic England Level 2 (as set out in Understanding Historic Buildings: A Guide to Good Recording Practice, 2016)) of the Chapel shall be undertaken and submitted to the local planning authority and the Ealing Local History Centre.

Reason: To record the presence and details of the paintings in the interest of advancing the understanding of historical assets in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to the commencement of the development, a detailed Schedule of Works and Method Statement shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing. The Method Statement should provide the opportunity for the work to be inspected by the Council at agreed intervals throughout the construction works should this be considered necessary. The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).

| Suitable precautions must be undertaken to secure and protect all interior and exterior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work and no such elements may be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).

| Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 6 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).

| Except where indicated otherwise on the approved drawings or as required by any condition(s) attached to this consent, all new finishes and works of making-good and dimensions and profiles of joinery, stonework, tiling and all other finishes shall match the existing original adjacent work in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).
| Prior to the commencement of development detailed drawings at minimum scale 1:10 shall be submitted show the following details:
-	Details of the treatment of the existing roof trusses where they pass through the proposed roof of the studios
-	Details of how the roof of the studio will adjoin the existing walls of the Chapel
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details so agreed and shall be retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Internal alterations to the Chapel comprising the installation of total 28 artists studios over ground and first floors, a shared exhibition/community space, associated ancillary facilities and new mechanical and electrical services. (Listed Building Consent)
